properties.title: Royal Engineers Museum
properties.description: Royal Engineers Museum, Prince Arthur Road, Brompton, Gillingham, Kent, ME7 1URInformation: The Royal Engineers Museum is Kent's only designated museum of national and international importance. It provides a fascinating insight into the debt owed by Britain to its soldier engineers from the earliest times to the present day.Web link: http://www.medway.gov.uk/leisureandculture/museums/royalengineersmuseum.aspxTelephone 01634 822839

properties.title: The Old Brook Pumping Station
properties.description: The Old Brook Pumping Station, Solomons Road, Chatham, Kent, ME4 4AJInformation: Since the 16th century there has been some form of earth dam that has cut Chatham off from the River Medway. This was originally called the Land Wall. In more recent times, it has become the river wall, part of the flood defences...Web link: http://www.medway.gov.uk/leisureandculture/museums/oldbrookpumpingstation.aspxTelephone 01634 3333333

properties.title: Museum Of The Royal Dockyard
properties.description: Museum Of The Royal Dockyard, Anchor Wharf, Main Gate Road, Historic Dockyard, Chatham, Kent, ME4 4SXInformation: Chatham Dockyard Historical Society was founded in 1980 by a group of dockyard workers dedicated to perpetuating the history and work of Chatham Dockyard. By the time the dockyard closed in 1984, they had created a museum of dockyard and naval artefacts in the old Lead and Print Mill. In the spring of 2001, the Society's historical collection was amalgamated with the Historic Dockyard Trust's own collection to form the new larger Museum of The Royal Dockyard in the Fitted Rigging House, on Anchor Wharf. The Society is very active, staffing the museum, meeting the public and dealing with many and varied questions. The Society's reference library is thought to be one of the finest sources of nautical history in the south-east.Web link: http://www.medway.gov.uk/leisureandculture/museums/museumoftheroyaldockyard.aspxTelephone 01634 832028

properties.title: Kent Police Museum
properties.description: Kent Police Museum, Old Posthouse, Church Lane, Historic Dockyard, Chatham, Kent, ME4 4TEInformation: The Police Museum was started as a collection of Police memorabilia in the 1960's by officers who felt there was a need to show the history of Kent Police... Web link: http://www.kent-police-museum.co.uk/Telephone 01634 403260

properties.title: The Guildhall Museum
properties.description: The Guildhall Museum, High Street, Rochester, Kent, ME1 1PYInformation: The Rochester Guildhall was built in 1687 and is one of the finest 17th-century civic buildings in Kent. Its staircase and main hall have magnificent plaster ceilings, given in 1695 by Admiral Sir Cloudsley Shovell, who was the Member of Parliament for the city of Rochester at the time. Outside, mounted on the roof, is an amazing weather vane in the form of a fully rigged 18th-century warship. This is 1.52m tall and weighs just under 51kg. It is made of gilded copper and lead alloy and has weathered the ever-changing climate since 1780.Web link: http://www.medway.gov.uk/leisureandculture/museums/guildhallmuseum.aspxTelephone 01634 848717
